text: In the past five years, the share price of Dollar General has nearly tripled, outpacing the broader stock market by some 80 per cent. But what do the discount chains do to poor communities? https://t.co/kBEs1EIJ3e

text: Tom Laffay’s documentary “Siona” offers a closeup look at the courageous work of demining the Siona territory, which has been marred by explosive devices that were planted during the Colombian civil war. Watch here. https://t.co/2X2NJ4HReE

name: NewYorker
text: An organizer and anti-racism trainer discusses the origins and effects of structural racism, and whether the current demonstrations could be a turning point for the country. Listen here. https://t.co/SrOZEOa0Se

name: NewYorker
text: Around the world, successful reopenings have been enabled by robust coronavirus testing, contact tracing, isolation, and treatment programs. In Texas, testing efforts remain confusing and stunted.  https://t.co/WSXCPs6pt1

text:
"The statues are being toppled, but the story that built them remains," the historian David W. Blight writes. "If this is to be our 1989, we must make the most of it. The whole world may be watching."

text: Robert Mueller declined to issue a grand-jury subpoena for Donald Trump’s testimony, and he excluded from his report a conclusion that Trump had committed crimes. These decisions are the most revealing features of Mueller’s tenure, @JeffreyToobin writes. https://t.co/SKK3KNUV0N
